import pandas as pd
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, to_date , to_timestamp
from pyspark.sql.types import IntegerType, DoubleType




csv_df  = spark.read.option("recursiveFileLookup","true").csv("abfss://data@dp203dushyantdatalake.dfs.core.windows.net/sales_data/poscsv/*",header=True)

parquet_df = spark.read \
    .option("recursiveFileLookup", "true").parquet("abfss://data@dp203dushyantdatalake.dfs.core.windows.net/sales_data/posparquet/")

csv_df.count()

# Drop na
csv_df = csv_df.dropna()

# Drop duplicates
csv_df = csv_df.dropDuplicates()

print(csv_df.dtypes)
csv_df.count()

# Convert 'quantity' column to IntegerType
csv_df = csv_df.withColumn("quantity", col("quantity").cast(IntegerType()))

# Convert 'price' column to DoubleType
csv_df = csv_df.withColumn("price", col("price").cast(DoubleType()))

# Convert 'total_amount' column to DoubleType
csv_df = csv_df.withColumn("total_amount", col("total_amount").cast(DoubleType()))

# Cast the sale_date column to TIMESTAMP
csv_df = csv_df.withColumn("sale_date", col("sale_date").cast("TIMESTAMP"))

# Show the DataFrame and schema to verify changes
csv_df.printSchema()

# Example transformation: Calculate total sales by region
sales_df = csv_df.groupBy("region","product_name").agg({"total_amount": "sum"})
sales_df.show()

# Define the table name
table_name = "Sales_data"

# Drop the table if it exists
drop_table_sql = f"DROP TABLE IF EXISTS {table_name}"
spark.sql(drop_table_sql)

# Create the table with appropriate schema
create_table_sql = f"""
CREATE TABLE {table_name}
(
    sale_id STRING,
    product_id STRING,
    product_name STRING,
    quantity INT,
    price DOUBLE,
    total_amount DOUBLE,
    sale_date TIMESTAMP,
    region STRING
)
WITH
(
    DISTRIBUTION = ROUND_ROBIN,
    CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
)
"""
spark.sql(create_table_sql)

# Limit the DataFrame to 100 rows
csv_df_limited = csv_df.limit(100)
